content.body: Is there a way to query if an object has no properties without instantiating an array?
I've heard that in some engines Object.keys avoids an array allocation if the object hasn't de-opted and still has a hidden-class
content.formatted_body: I've heard that in some engines Object.keys avoids an array allocation if the object hasn't de-opted and still has a hidden-class

content.body: you could use for-in and skip non-own properties. but Iâ€™d be surprised if the array caused issues in practice
